title: Intern Pete tries selling Kyle and Jackie O's TRASH on eBay
text:
He's been involved in a number of stunts during his time on the Kyle and Jackie O Show.

And now Intern Pete has gone to extreme lengths - trying to sell some of the pair's trash on eBay.

Appearing live on air on the KIIS FM show this week, Intern Pete revealed he was trying to sell used tissues and even an unfinished can of Coke online.

Would you cough up the cash for that? Intern Pete (pictured) tries selling Kyle and Jackie O's TRASH including a used tissue and an unfinished soft drink on eBay

He also had listed some computer equipment, much to the disgust of the pair.

'That's disgusting I don't want my used tissue being sold,' Jackie told Intern Pete, whose real name is Pete Deppeler.

'That's your DNA right there that's gold,' Pete said.

Grossed out: Jackie was disgusted by the fact her used tissue was up for sale and didn't hold back

Jackie's second featured item on the list was a bottle of Coca-Cola posted on Ebay.

'It's only up for 10 bucks but by the time it's sold we think we will get some pretty good cash for it,' Pete said.

The item Kyle found to be absolutely 'outrageous' was a bag of air from inside the studio that Pete had collected and posted online for $4,000.

Say what? The item Kyle (pictured) found to be absolutely 'outrageous' was a bag of air from inside the studio that Pete had collected and posted online for $4,000

Would anyone actually buy that? Pictured is the bag of air from the studio

The final items up from grabs was the broken touch screen of the 48-year-old broadcaster that was coated in finger prints from years of use.

'Those are genuine Kyle Sanderlands finger prints - this is my money-maker holiday spending money,' Pete said.

'No one is going to want an old LG computer screen,' Kyle said.

'I honest think I can get at least five, six hundred, maybe even a grand,' Pete relied.

At the end of the presentation a producer interrupted the segment to let the crew known Pete's Ebay account had been shut down during the broadcast as the items did not belong to him.
description: He's been involved in a number of stunts during his time on the Kyle and Jackie O Show.
authors: Tom Place For Daily Mail Australia
